segment.source: Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan (Windows 10)
segment.target: Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan (Windows 10)

segment.source: Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan
segment.target: Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan

segment.source: Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan
segment.target: Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: The following are important factors in the implementation of your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design plan:
segment.target: The following are important factors in the implementation of your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design plan:

segment.source: Group Policy.
segment.target: Group Policy.

segment.source: The Windows Firewall with Advanced Security designs make extensive use of Group Policy deployed by Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
segment.target: The Windows Firewall with Advanced Security designs make extensive use of Group Policy deployed by Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

segment.source: A sound Group Policy infrastructure is required to successfully deploy the firewall and IPsec settings and rules to the devices on your network.
segment.target: A sound Group Policy infrastructure is required to successfully deploy the firewall and IPsec settings and rules to the devices on your network.

segment.source: Perimeter firewall.
segment.target: Perimeter firewall.

segment.source: Most organizations use a perimeter firewall to help protect the devices on the network from potentially malicious network traffic from outside of the organization's network boundaries.
segment.target: Most organizations use a perimeter firewall to help protect the devices on the network from potentially malicious network traffic from outside of the organization's network boundaries.

segment.source: If you plan a deployment that includes a boundary zone to enable external devices to connect to devices in that zone, then you must allow that traffic through the perimeter firewall to the devices in the boundary zone.
segment.target: If you plan a deployment that includes a boundary zone to enable external devices to connect to devices in that zone, then you must allow that traffic through the perimeter firewall to the devices in the boundary zone.

segment.source: Devices running operating systems other than Windows.
segment.target: Devices running operating systems other than Windows.

segment.source: If your network includes devices that are not running the Windows operating system, then you must make sure that required communication with those devices is not blocked by the restrictions put in place by your design.
segment.target: If your network includes devices that are not running the Windows operating system, then you must make sure that required communication with those devices is not blocked by the restrictions put in place by your design.

segment.source: You must do one of the following:
segment.target: You must do one of the following:

segment.source: Include those devices in the isolated domain or zone by adding certificate-based authentication to your design.
segment.target: Include those devices in the isolated domain or zone by adding certificate-based authentication to your design.

segment.source: Many other operating systems can participate in an isolated domain or isolated server scenario, as long as certificate-based authentication is used.
segment.target: Many other operating systems can participate in an isolated domain or isolated server scenario, as long as certificate-based authentication is used.

segment.source: Include the device in the authentication exemption list included in your design.
segment.target: Include the device in the authentication exemption list included in your design.

segment.source: You can choose this option if for any reason the device cannot participate in the isolated domain design.
segment.target: You can choose this option if for any reason the device cannot participate in the isolated domain design.

segment.source: How to implement your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design using this guide
segment.target: How to implement your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design using this guide

segment.source: The next step in implementing your design is to determine in what order each of the deployment steps must be performed.
segment.target: The next step in implementing your design is to determine in what order each of the deployment steps must be performed.

segment.source: This guide uses checklists to help you accomplish the various deployment tasks that are required to implement your design plan.
segment.target: This guide uses checklists to help you accomplish the various deployment tasks that are required to implement your design plan.

segment.source: As the following diagram shows, checklists and subchecklists are used as necessary to provide the end-to-end procedure for deploying a design.
segment.target: As the following diagram shows, checklists and subchecklists are used as necessary to provide the end-to-end procedure for deploying a design.

segment.source: wfas implementation
segment.target: wfas implementation

segment.source: Use the following parent checklists in this section of the guide to become familiar with the deployment tasks for implementing your organization's Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design.
segment.target: Use the following parent checklists in this section of the guide to become familiar with the deployment tasks for implementing your organization's Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design.

segment.source: Checklist: Implementing a Basic Firewall Policy Design
segment.target: Checklist: Implementing a Basic Firewall Policy Design

segment.source: Checklist: Implementing a Domain Isolation Policy Design
segment.target: Checklist: Implementing a Domain Isolation Policy Design

segment.source: Checklist: Implementing a Domain Isolation Policy Design
segment.target: Checklist: Implementing a Domain Isolation Policy Design

segment.source: Checklist: Implementing a Certificate-based Isolation Policy Design
segment.target: Checklist: Implementing a Certificate-based Isolation Policy Design

segment.source: The procedures in these checklists use the Group Policy MMC snap-in interfaces to configure firewall and connection security rules in GPOs, but you can also use Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: The procedures in these checklists use the Group Policy MMC snap-in interfaces to configure firewall and connection security rules in GPOs, but you can also use Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Administration with Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Administration with Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: This guide recommends using GPOs in a specific way to deploy the rules and settings for your design.
segment.target: This guide recommends using GPOs in a specific way to deploy the rules and settings for your design.

segment.source: For information about deploying your GPOs, see Planning Group Policy Deployment for Your Isolation Zones and the checklist Checklist: Creating Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: For information about deploying your GPOs, see Planning Group Policy Deployment for Your Isolation Zones and the checklist Checklist: Creating Group Policy Objects.
